artist: Artist: Frantisek Jaroslav Pecka and spirits
creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: image of a woman emerging from an abstract, multicolored flower; multicolored linear plumes sit on top of woman's head
inscription: There are inscriptions in tiny script at the top; it is hard to tell whether this is spirit writing or in a known language -- more study and analysis is needed. Some portion includes equations.
markings: LLC, verso: gallery label from Andrew Edlin Gallery
text: A woman emerges from a flower or colorful plant. She and the plant are dressed and decorated in eye-dazzling multicolored patterns. This is the work of a Czech medium who made such drawings at seances (communal rituals to contact spirits) in a trance state. Pecka would have entered a state in which he allowed spirits to guide his hand and bring forth images of the spirits trying to convey messages. This drawing resulted from one of those sessions.
title: Untitled
